main contribution may have been in the combination of the use of movable type, the art of making such type, the use of oil-based ink, and the wooden printing press, which was presumably derived from the various presses in use at the time, including those for book-binding and those used in wine-making and in olive-oil production.

Combining these elements into a production system permitted the rapid printing of written materials, which fed the information-hungry world of Renaissance Europe.
